resources.string:
"Psychrometrics is the study of air and water vapor mixtures; temperature, relative humidity and dew point are some common psychrometric properties. PsyCalc® provides direct access to these and other properties plus mixing and process calculators.
PsyCalc® is used by thousands of users on their desktop. It uses the most widely accepted psychrometric calculation routines available and provides an easy to use interface with immediate results.
Point tab - find psychrometric properties. Mixing tab - perform air mixing calculations. Process tab - point-to-point load calculations. Defaults tab - set start up defaults.
This version of PsyCalc® functions the same as previous desktop versions. Set input property types using the button to the right of each value. Enter input property values. Results update immediately upon any change.
'Exceeds Limits' is displayed if the calculation is beyond limits or unavailable.
Air and Water Vapor Properties in PsyCalc®
Psychrometric - °Fdb / °Cdb - Dry Bulb Temperature °Fwb / °Cwb - Wet Bulb Temperature %RH - Relative Humidity Btu/lb / kJ/kg - Enthalpy °Fdp / °Cdp - Dew Point Temperature gr/lb / g/kg - Humidity Ratio ft≥/lb - m≥/kg - Specific Volume in Hg VP / mm Hg VP - Vapor Pressure lb/ft³ / kg/m³ - Density PPMw - Parts Per Million by weight PPMv - Parts Per Million by volume gr/ft³ / g/m³ - Absolute Humidity
Pressure - Alt in Ft / m - Altitude (elevation). psia / kPa - Absolute Pressure.
PsyCalc® Limits - Dry bulb Temperature: °F / °C -80 to 1500 / -62.2 to 815.5 Dew Point Temperature: °F / °C -80 to 200 / -62.2 to 93.3 Absolute Pressure: psia / kPa 0.7 to 400 13.8 to 2757
Because all calculations that model physical phenomenon are to some extent approximations users should always check to see that tools such as PsyCalc® return results accurate enough for the users needs. "
